intro: Leucanthemum macrocephalum, commonly known as the Shasta daisy, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to western North America. It features showy, white ray florets surrounding a central yellow disk, giving it a daisy-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped, dark green leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
